intro: Megalastrum gompholepis, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of red, orange, or yellow. The plant has palmate leaves with a velvety texture and is often found in moist, shaded environments. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is a subject of interest in botanical studies and conservation efforts.
